intro: Asteriastigma macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited asteriastigma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
